result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J Van Der Kooy

records.addlTxt: Signed by Defendant on 10-19-22
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant Steven J Van Der Kooy in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Steven J Van Der Kooy.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests time for defendant to complete a program for his current extended supervision.
Defense request plea and sentencing date in January.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to commit no new law violations.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to disclose all prescriptions to the Court.  Defendant to have all prescriptions filled at the same pharmacy.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

9:30 AM Defendant Steven J Van Der Kooy appeared by video.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Steven J Van Der Kooy.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for some discovery on the newer matter.
State advises it was sent on 8/29/22 and the Defense should receive it soon.
Court addresses motion to modify bond in 22CM1054.
State has no objection.
Statements by the Defense.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court grants the motion to modify bond.  Court orders conditions of bond modified to no violent contact with Victim A.
Defendant to sign new bond before the conditions go into effect.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
